meanings.definition: Having male and female reproductive organs on the same plant.
meanings.sent1: The synoicous plant had both male and female parts growing together.
meanings.sent2: The synoicous flower displayed both male and female reproductive organs.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the synoicous plant trying to decide which flower to pollinate first.
meanings.sent4: The synoicous nature of the plant symbolized unity and balance in nature.
meanings.sent5: The synoicous plant was a perfect example of nature's efficiency in reproduction.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a plant with both male and female reproductive structures on the same individual.
meanings.sent1: The synoicous tree was admired for its unique reproductive structures.
meanings.sent2: In the garden, the synoicous shrub stood out with its combined reproductive features.
meanings.sent3: The synoicous plant seemed to be quite proud of its ability to self-pollinate.
meanings.sent4: The synoicous characteristics of the plant made it a fascinating subject for botanists.
meanings.sent5: The synoicous plant's ability to reproduce efficiently was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the presence of both male and female reproductive structures on a single plant.
meanings.sent1: The synoicous vine was a perfect example of nature's diversity.
meanings.sent2: The synoicous plant was a marvel with its dual reproductive structures.
meanings.sent3: The synoicous plant's ability to reproduce on its own was quite convenient.
meanings.sent4: The synoicous plant's reproductive strategy was a lesson in efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The synoicous plant's reproductive system was a testament to nature's ingenuity.
